intro: Saussurea bijiangensis, commonly known as the Bijiang safflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions, often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited study, its ecological role and genetic diversity remain poorly understood.
